TopicTitle: I am a new person. I play the game. I killed Jebediah with a decoupler.

Articles.Content:
Hello, fellow Jebediah murderers!

I have been playing for 1 month and am now a verified rocket scientist from the East Virginia Clown College of West Virginia, New York. I've been reading this forum for awhile now, so I thought I'd join. Then I changed my mind.

Hi!

Edited November 21, 2013 by 957Chatterton
I see jeb's spirit has possed you

Squish! Don't know how many times I've killed Jeb in previous playthroughs. Last time I landed a plane into him. The time before that was a solid rocket booster testing sled. Before that was an orange tank through the Crew Module of my space station. This time, I'm hoping he lasts.

Welcome to the Forums!
The ghosts of a thousand Jebs smile and wave at you. XD

Don't worry he will be back. He is impossible to kill. I annihilated him with an extra large tank of antimatter that lost its containment (Interstellar Mod). He showed up a couple of missions later ready to go again.
Welcome! Now that you have kill Jeb you will now have bad pilots. If you kill Bill Bob and Kurt you will have a bad program.
I still havnt killed Jeb!! Hes survived over 20 missions, but now hes stuck on the mun.

Ah yes, another day, another Jeb sacrificed under the altar that is scientific progress. My Jeb is imprisoned hanging out on the safety of my space station at the moment, so I don't kill him. Anyway, welcome to the forums Chatter, enjoy your stay!

Hello there fellow Kerbalnaut, glad to have you on board. There can never be to many eager scientists, especialy if there is an unlimited supply of sacrificial lambs....*cough*...I mean, brave volunteers to test the newest, fastestes, biggest rockets we can come up with.

So share your knowledge and storys with us, so we, together, may find new and creative things to do in and with space.

Thank you all for the welcome!

On a serious note, I've thoroughly enjoyed this game for its mathematics involved. Even with Mechjeb, I've enjoyed calculating Delta V just to prove I could reliably do it.

Edited November 21, 2013 by 957Chatterton
